posts.name: Evelyn
posts.cooked:
This is probably a really simple solution that I’m overlooking, but our team has code for a swerve drive and we’re getting this message: image 765×560 32.9 KB Our code compiles fine, but when it reaches the roborio it crashes. Driverstation says connected but no robotcode.

image 765×560 32.9 KB

image 765×560 32.9 KB

The main thing we’re looking at is the class not found exception, which we don’t know how to fix as it’s within the yagsl library. We have the Navx Library and all other libraries from the yagsl example installed.

Thanks for any help

posts.name: James
posts.cooked: How are you connecting to the Navx? Are you connected through usb? Or on the Rio?

posts.name: James
posts.cooked: I think the way you are trying to connect to it is incorrect. This is what we do for connecting through usb 2025-Reefscape-Competition/src/main/deploy/swerve/swervedrive.json at main · FRC3546/2025-Reefscape-Competition · GitHub

posts.name: James
posts.cooked: I think it should be id 0, since it is not on the canbus

posts.name: Evelyn
posts.cooked: I tried that but it still doesn’t work

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: I suspect you have an out of date vendordep, either NavX/Studica or YAGSL .

posts.name: Evelyn
posts.cooked: NavX says that it is on the 2024.1.0 version. I can’t find anything newer and the wpilib manager can’t update it. Studica: 2025.0.1 YAGSL : 2025.3.1-beta1 (I tried the non beta version as well)
I do not know why it is not working, that’s odd.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:
Someone modified the NavX vendordep. Before it was modified, your code wouldn’t have compiled and would have printed the following error message.

Now it’s broken at runtime since someone did that.

Delete the NavX vendordep and rebuild. It’s covered by the Studica vendordep.

suggested_topics.title: WPILib Elastic 2025 missing Reefscape field
suggested_topics.excerpt: The Check for WPILib updates command doesn’t update tools. To get updated tools, you need to grab the updated wpilib installer. The 2025.2.1 one has the new elastic.
